column1: #Text=[0058] Both .DELTA..phi..sub.RF and .theta..sub.RF are adjusted iteratively by the DSP to get the optimum result of A.sub..DELTA..phi.RF=1/{square root}2 exactly from Equation 3.

#Text=[0059] Therefore, for a starting setting of .DELTA..phi..sub.RF first adjust the DSB-SC phase shifter 53 .theta..sub.RF of the calibration tone to make I and Q rms levels equal and check Equation 3 if A.sub..DELTA..phi.RF=1/{square root}2 exactly.
#Text=If A.sub..DELTA..phi.RF=/=-1/{square root}2, change the value of .DELTA..phi..sub.RF by small increments and adjust the DSB-SC phase shift .theta..sub.RF again to make I and Q rms levels equal.
#Text=Finally, check Equation 3 to see if A.sub..DELTA..phi.RF=1/{square root}2 exactly.
#Text=If not, repeat the process until A.sub..DELTA..phi.RF=1/{square root}2 exactly.
#Text=In other words, the steps in this process are equivalent to those shown in FIG. 4B except the final phase adjustment is performed iteratively by the DSP instead of using a look-up table.
#Text=[0060] Using this method, the systematic IQ phase error can be calibrated by the DSP 40 independently of the frequency dependent IQ phase error.
#Text=[0061] As described in the Background of Invention section, frequency dependent IQ phase errors must also be calibrated and corrected.
#Text=In another embodiment realized by the present invention, the frequency dependent IQ phase errors may be calibrated in the following manner with reference to FIG. 4C.
#Text=[0062] The IQ phase errors due to filter errors in the base band paths (66 and 67) are computed at a frequency F.sub.BB.
#Text=For a base band calibration tone of Sin(.omega..sub.BB.t) in the transmitter, the corresponding receiver signals are
